results.title: The Hour before my brother dies
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Daniel Keene, James Clayden and Noel Price
results.brief_description: Adapted from the stage play by Daniel Keene. Sally visits her brother Martin, the hour before he is due to be hanged for murder. What is the hold these two have on each other physically and emotionally? Cast includes Peter Hehir (Martin), Rhonda Wilson (Sally), Reg Evans (father) and Margot Duell (mother).

results.title: The Hour
results.creator_credit: BBC, Kudos, Ruth Kenley-Letts and Noelle Morris
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes drama and espionage thriller in Cold War-era England that centers on a journalist, a producer, and an anchorman for an investigative news programme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, Kudos, Ruth Kenley-Letts and Noelle Morris

results.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
Touted as being the greatest detective story every written, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s horror story is also famous for being the novel that brought the resurrection of Sherlock Holmes, and the beginning of the commercialisation of his most famous detective. Killed off in “The Final problem” in 1893, Holmes met his fate after falling into a waterfall chasing his nemesis, Moriaty - neither body was recovered. Years later, Conan Doyle became interested in folklore surrounding the legend of the Hound of the Baskervilles: Sir Hugo and his hounds of hell, punished by a fierce dog for attacking a young woman, his family fated to misfortune forever after. The only man up to the task was Holmes, and the claim was made that the Baskerville investigation was an old case rediscovered after his death. This program in “Nightmare: the birth of horror” series examines the locales, literature and country folklore that influenced Conan Doyle when writing the novel - significantly, the only one to demonstrate his interest in the natural and the supernatural world. Provides depictions of Holmes across print and screen, and what Professor Christopher Frayling believes makes the book a classic.

group_siblings.title: Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde = Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde

results.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
results.creator_credit: Graham Evans, William Stirling and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes is enlisted by Dr Mortimer to investigate the case in which one of his patients, Sir Charles, appeared to die from terror. Originating from the Baskerville family, the lineage includes the infamy of Sir Hugo Baskerville who died after having this throat torn out - the woman he was pursuing died from shock after witnessing the incident. Since then, legend has perpetuated of a monstrous dog prowling the moors and of the numerous family members who have lost their lives to the mysterious canine. Inheriting the property on Charles’ death Sir Henry, a cautious Mortimer, is not so sure Charles’ safety can be ensured given the history at the manor and Holmes places Watson there to keep an eye on proceedings. Dramatised by Hugh Leonard, Peter Cushing stars as Sherlock Holmes in the novel by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, first published in “The Strand” in 1901/1902 and in novel form in 1902. Cast also includes Gary Raymond, Gabriella Licudi, Philip Bond, Gerald Flood.

results.title: The Hottest show on earth
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Schon, Derek Lamb, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A humourous film on the subject of home insulation. Topics include: the origins of fossil fuels, how to optimise furnace efficiency, common areas of home heat loss, weather-stripping and insulation. Narrated by David Suzuki.

results.title: The Hotel New Hampshire
results.creator_credit: Tony Richardson, Neil Hartley and Woodfall Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is a fascinating, largely successful adaptation of John Irving’s 1981 novel of the same name. The tale concerns an eccentric New England family that, spurred on by an ever-searching father, establishes a new hotel in locale after locale which mutates in the process. It is a bizarre and whimsical tale starring Rob Lowe and Jodie Foster in the role of brother and sister and Natassja Kinski as a girl so insecure that she hides most of the time inside an enormous bear suit.

results.title: The Hot head
results.brief_description: The problems of efficient fuel consumption in the automobile engine. Laboratory tests demonstrate complete and incomplete combustion of carbon; the influence of engine design on combustion efficiency; efficient burning through atomisation of fuel; design of the valve-in-head for maximum combustion and minimum power wastage; movement of the fuel mixture; removal of gases and control of the fuel mixture.

results.title: The Hot date
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. A put upon adolescent is faced with the unusual problem of potential self-combustion whenever he gets nervous. As a result, his fear is palpable when it comes to his first date. His reluctance is soon overcome as things go well and he decides to invite his love into the bedroom…what happens next is surprising and hilarious!

results.title: The Hot-blooded dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates, Robin Brightwell, WGBH (Boston) and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Challenges our conventional ideas of dinosaurs. Argues that they were not slow-moving, cold blooded reptiles, but were agile, intelligent and hot-blooded. Points out that they didn’t all die out and that their descendants are alive and well and living all around us.

results.title: The Hospital
results.brief_description: Depicts the many departments and services to be found in a hospital. Explains the work of different staff members and illustrates what is involved in diagnosing an illness and caryring out the necessary medical treatment. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
